Grammar and Structure: - Ce mois-ci j’essaie de faire attention à mes dépenses means “This month I’m trying to watch my spending”. “Faire attention à” means “to be careful with”.- J’ai un peu trop dépensé le mois dernier, surtout en restos means “I spent a bit too much last month, especially on restaurants”. “Restos” is short for “restaurants”.- Du coup, je cuisine plus à la maison means “So now I cook more at home”. “Du coup” is a common way to say “so” or “as a result”.
Transliteration: This month I try to pay attention to my expenses. I have a bit too much spent last month, especially in restaurants. So, I cook more at the house.

Phrase: J’ai eu un souci avec ma banque, ils ont bloqué ma carte sans prévenir. J’ai dû les appeler trois fois pour régler ça. C’était super chiant.
English: I had an issue with my bank—they blocked my card without warning. I had to call them three times to sort it out. It was really annoying.
Grammar and Structure: - J’ai eu un souci avec ma banque means “I had an issue with my bank”. “Souci” is a casual word for “problem” or “worry”.- Ils ont bloqué ma carte sans prévenir means “They blocked my card without warning”. “Sans prévenir” means “without telling me first”.- J’ai dû les appeler trois fois pour régler ça means “I had to call them three times to fix it”. “Régler ça” is “to sort that out”.- C’était super chiant is slang for “It was really annoying”. “Super chiant” literally means “super annoying / a pain”.
Transliteration: I have had a problem with my bank, they have blocked my card without warning. I have had to call them three times to fix that. It was super annoying.

Phrase: Perso, je préfère les séries aux films. Je trouve ça plus facile à suivre, et j’adore quand l’histoire se développe sur plusieurs épisodes.
English: Personally, I prefer series over movies. I find it easier to follow, and I love when the story develops over several episodes.
Grammar and Structure: - Perso, je préfère les séries aux films means “Personally, I prefer series over movies”. “Perso” is short for “personnellement”, and “aux films” is “to movies”.- Je trouve ça plus facile à suivre means “I find it easier to follow”. “Ça” means “that / it”, and “à suivre” is “to follow”.- J’adore quand l’histoire se développe sur plusieurs épisodes means “I love when the story develops over several episodes”. “Se développe” means “unfolds / develops”, and “plusieurs épisodes” is “several episodes”.
Transliteration: Personally, I prefer the series to the films. I find that more easy to follow, and I love when the story develops over several episodes.

Phrase: Mon coloc est super drôle, toujours en train de sortir des blagues. Il est aussi très organisé, ce qui est cool pour la colocation.
English: My roommate is really funny, always making jokes. He’s also very organized, which is great for living together.
Grammar and Structure: - Mon coloc est super drôle means “My roommate is really funny”. “Coloc” is short for “colocataire”.- Toujours en train de sortir des blagues means “Always making jokes”. “Sortir des blagues” literally means “to bring out jokes”.- Il est aussi très organisé means “He is also very organized”.- Ce qui est cool pour la colocation means “Which is great for living together”. “Colocation” means “shared living” or “flat-sharing”.
Transliteration: My roommate is super funny, always in the process of making jokes. He is also very organized, which is cool for the shared living.

Phrase: Ce week-end, je vais sûrement aller au marché le samedi matin. Après, j’ai prévu un brunch avec des amis. Et dimanche, chill total à la maison.
English: This weekend, I’ll probably go to the market on Saturday morning. After that, I’ve planned a brunch with some friends. And Sunday, total chill at home.
Grammar and Structure: - Ce week-end, je vais sûrement aller au marché le samedi matin means “This weekend, I’ll probably go to the market on Saturday morning”. “Je vais sûrement” is “I’ll probably”, and “aller au marché” means “go to the market”.- Après, j’ai prévu un brunch avec des amis means “After that, I’ve planned a brunch with some friends”. “J’ai prévu” is “I planned / I’ve planned”.- Et dimanche, chill total à la maison means “And Sunday, total chill at home”. “Chill total” is casual slang for “completely relaxing”, and “à la maison” means “at home”.
Transliteration: This weekend, I’m surely going to go to the market the Saturday morning. After, I have planned a brunch with some friends. And Sunday, total chill at the house.

Phrase: J’aimerais bien partir vivre à l’étranger un jour. Peut-être au Canada ou au Portugal, je sais pas encore. J’ai envie de changer d’air et découvrir autre chose.
English: I’d really like to go live abroad one day. Maybe in Canada or Portugal, I don’t know yet. I want a change of scenery and to discover something new.
Grammar and Structure: - J’aimerais bien partir vivre à l’étranger un jour means “I’d really like to go live abroad one day”. “J’aimerais bien” is “I’d really like”, “partir vivre” is “leave to live”, and “à l’étranger” is “abroad”.- Peut-être au Canada ou au Portugal, je sais pas encore means “Maybe in Canada or Portugal, I don’t know yet”. “Je sais pas encore” is “I don’t know yet”.- J’ai envie de changer d’air et découvrir autre chose means “I want a change of scenery and to discover something new”. “Changer d’air” literally means “change the air”, an expression for “getting away”, and “découvrir autre chose” is “discover something else”.
Transliteration: I would like well to leave live abroad one day. Maybe to Canada or to Portugal, I don’t know yet. I have desire to change air and discover something else.

Phrase: J’ai passé un entretien ce matin, je crois que ça s’est bien passé. J’étais un peu stressé au début, mais après ça allait. On verra bien.
English: I had an interview this morning, and I think it went well. I was a bit nervous at first, but then it was fine. We’ll see.
Grammar and Structure: - J’ai passé un entretien ce matin means “I had an interview this morning”. “Passer un entretien” is the phrase for “doing an interview”.- Je crois que ça s’est bien passé means “I think it went well”. “Ça s’est bien passé” means “it went well”.- J’étais un peu stressé au début, mais après ça allait means “I was a bit stressed at the start, but then it was okay”. “Ça allait” means “it was fine / manageable”.- On verra bien means “We’ll see”. It’s a common way to say “Let’s hope for the best” or “Wait and see”.
Transliteration: I have passed an interview this morning, I think that it went well. I was a bit stressed at the beginning, but after it was okay. We will see well.

Phrase: J’utilise une appli pour suivre mes dépenses, c’est super pratique. Avant je notais tout à la main, mais là c’est plus simple. Y’a plein de stats aussi.
English: I use an app to track my expenses—it’s super convenient. Before, I used to write everything by hand, but now it’s easier. There are lots of stats too.
Grammar and Structure: - J’utilise une appli pour suivre mes dépenses means “I use an app to track my expenses”. “Appli” is short for “application”, and “suivre mes dépenses” means “track my spending”.- C’est super pratique means “It’s super convenient”.- Avant je notais tout à la main, mais là c’est plus simple means “Before, I wrote everything by hand, but now it’s easier”. “À la main” is “by hand”, and “c’est plus simple” means “it’s simpler”.- Y’a plein de stats aussi is casual for “Il y a plein de statistiques aussi”, meaning “There are lots of stats too”.
Transliteration: I use an app to follow my expenses, it’s super practical. Before, I noted everything by hand, but now it’s more simple. There is lots of stats also.

Phrase: Hier, j’ai renversé du café sur mon ordi. Grosse galère, il s’est éteint direct. Heureusement, il remarche ce matin. J’ai eu chaud.
English: Yesterday, I spilled coffee on my laptop. Total nightmare—it shut off immediately. Luckily, it’s working again this morning. That was a close one.
Grammar and Structure: - Hier, j’ai renversé du café sur mon ordi means “Yesterday, I spilled coffee on my laptop”. “Renversé” means “spilled”, and “ordi” is short for “ordinateur” (computer).- Grosse galère, il s’est éteint direct means “Total nightmare—it shut off immediately”. “Grosse galère” is slang for “big problem”, and “direct” means “right away”.- Heureusement, il remarche ce matin means “Luckily, it’s working again this morning”. “Remarche” comes from “remarcher” meaning “to work again”.- J’ai eu chaud is a casual way of saying “That was a close one”. Literally “I got hot”, but it means “Phew, that was close!”
Transliteration: Yesterday, I spilled some coffee on my computer. Big hassle, it turned off immediately. Luckily, it works again this morning. I was hot.

Phrase: Depuis que je bosse ici, j’ai appris plein de trucs. Surtout à gérer mon temps et à mieux communiquer. C’est super formateur.
English: Since I started working here, I’ve learned a lot. Especially how to manage my time and communicate better. It’s really a great learning experience.
Grammar and Structure: - Depuis que je bosse ici, j’ai appris plein de trucs means “Since I started working here, I’ve learned a lot”. “Bosser” is informal for “work”, and “plein de trucs” means “lots of things”.- Surtout à gérer mon temps et à mieux communiquer means “Especially how to manage my time and communicate better”. “Gérer mon temps” is “manage my time”, and “mieux communiquer” means “communicate better”.- C’est super formateur means “It’s really a great learning experience”. “Formateur” means “educational / something you learn a lot from”.
Transliteration: Since I work here, I have learned lots of things. Especially to manage my time and to better communicate. It is super educational.

Phrase: Je me suis remis au sport cette semaine. Juste un peu de course à pied et des étirements. J’ai mal partout mais ça fait du bien.
English: I got back into working out this week. Just a bit of running and some stretching. Everything hurts, but it feels good.
Grammar and Structure: - Je me suis remis au sport cette semaine means “I got back into working out this week”. “Se remettre à” means “to start again”, and “au sport” means “to sport / working out”.- Juste un peu de course à pied et des étirements means “Just a bit of running and some stretching”. “Course à pied” is “running”, and “étirements” are “stretches”.- J’ai mal partout mais ça fait du bien means “Everything hurts, but it feels good”. “J’ai mal partout” is “I’m sore everywhere”, and “ça fait du bien” is “it feels good / it does me good”.
Transliteration: I myself am put back to sport this week. Just a bit of running and some stretches. I have pain everywhere but it makes good.

Phrase: En ce moment, j’écoute beaucoup de jazz et de lo-fi. J’adore bosser avec ça en fond, c’est super chill. Si t’as des recos, je prends !
English: Lately, I’ve been listening to a lot of jazz and lo-fi. I love working with that in the background—it’s super chill. If you have any recs, I’m all ears!
Grammar and Structure: - En ce moment, j’écoute beaucoup de jazz et de lo-fi means “Right now, I’m listening to a lot of jazz and lo-fi”. “En ce moment” is “currently”, and “j’écoute beaucoup de” means “I listen to a lot of”.- J’adore bosser avec ça en fond, c’est super chill means “I love working with that in the background, it’s super chill”. “Bosser” is casual for “to work”, and “en fond” means “in the background”.- Si t’as des recos, je prends ! is a casual way of saying “If you have recommendations, I’d love them!” “T’as” is short for “tu as”, and “recos” is short for “recommandations”.
Transliteration: At the moment, I listen to a lot of jazz and lo-fi. I love working with that in background, it is super chill. If you have some recs, I take!

Phrase: Le matin, je prends le bus pour aller au taf. Ça me prend environ 30 minutes si y’a pas trop de monde. Je mets des écouteurs et je décroche.
English: In the morning, I take the bus to get to work. It takes me about 30 minutes if it’s not too crowded. I put on my headphones and zone out.
Grammar and Structure: - Le matin, je prends le bus pour aller au taf means “In the morning, I take the bus to get to work”. “Taf” is slang for “work”.- Ça me prend environ 30 minutes si y’a pas trop de monde means “It takes me about 30 minutes if it’s not too crowded”. “Environ” is “about”, and “trop de monde” means “too many people”.- Je mets des écouteurs et je décroche means “I put on my headphones and zone out”. “Mettre des écouteurs” is “to put on headphones”, and “décrocher” here means “to disconnect / zone out”.
Transliteration: The morning, I take the bus to go to work. That me takes around 30 minutes if there is not too much of people. I put on headphones and I disconnect.

Phrase: Il pleut non-stop depuis trois jours, j’en ai marre. Mon appart est tout sombre et j’ai même plus envie de sortir. Vivement le soleil !
English: It’s been raining non-stop for three days—I’m so over it. My apartment is all dark and I don’t even feel like going out. Can’t wait for the sun!
Grammar and Structure: - Il pleut non-stop depuis trois jours, j’en ai marre means “It’s been raining non-stop for three days, I’m so over it”. “Depuis trois jours” = “for three days”, and “j’en ai marre” = “I’m fed up”.- Mon appart est tout sombre et j’ai même plus envie de sortir means “My apartment is all dark and I don’t even feel like going out”. “Tout sombre” = “very dark”, “j’ai même plus envie” = “I don’t even want to”.- Vivement le soleil ! means “Can’t wait for the sun!” Literally: “Looking forward to the sun!”
Transliteration: It rains non-stop since three days, I’m fed up. My apartment is all dark and I don’t even want to go out. Hurry the sun!

Phrase: J’essaie d’apprendre l’espagnol depuis quelques mois. Je regarde des séries en VO et je note les mots que je comprends. C’est dur, mais j’aime bien le défi.
English: I’ve been trying to learn Spanish for a few months. I watch shows in the original version and write down the words I understand. It’s hard, but I like the challenge.
Grammar and Structure: - J’essaie d’apprendre l’espagnol depuis quelques mois means “I’ve been trying to learn Spanish for a few months”. “Depuis quelques mois” means “for a few months”.- Je regarde des séries en VO et je note les mots que je comprends means “I watch shows in the original version and write down the words I understand”. “En VO” stands for “en version originale”.- C’est dur, mais j’aime bien le défi means “It’s hard, but I like the challenge”. “J’aime bien” is a softer way to say “I like”, and “le défi” means “the challenge”.
Transliteration: I try to learn Spanish since some months. I watch series in original version and I note the words that I understand. It is hard, but I like the challenge.

Phrase: J’ai commandé une veste en ligne, mais la taille va pas du tout. J’ai galéré à trouver comment faire le retour. Franchement, ça me saoule.
English: I ordered a jacket online, but the size doesn’t fit at all. I struggled to figure out how to return it. Honestly, it’s so annoying.
Grammar and Structure: - J’ai commandé une veste en ligne means “I ordered a jacket online”. “En ligne” means “online”.- Mais la taille va pas du tout means “but the size doesn’t fit at all”. “Va pas du tout” is a casual way to say “doesn’t fit at all”.- J’ai galéré à trouver comment faire le retour means “I struggled to figure out how to return it”. “Galérer” is slang for “to struggle”.- Franchement, ça me saoule means “Honestly, it’s so annoying”. “Ça me saoule” is slang for “it annoys me / I’m fed up with it”.
Transliteration: I ordered a jacket online, but the size goes not at all. I struggled to find how to do the return. Honestly, that me annoys.

Phrase: Mon coloc laisse toujours traîner ses affaires partout. Je lui ai déjà dit, mais il oublie à chaque fois. Faut qu’on en parle sérieusement.
English: My roommate always leaves his stuff lying around. I’ve already told him, but he forgets every time. We need to talk about it seriously.
Grammar and Structure: - Mon coloc laisse toujours traîner ses affaires partout means “My roommate always leaves his stuff lying around”. “Laisse traîner” means “leaves lying around”, and “partout” means “everywhere”.- Je lui ai déjà dit, mais il oublie à chaque fois means “I’ve already told him, but he forgets every time”. “Je lui ai dit” is “I told him”, “à chaque fois” is “every time”.- Faut qu’on en parle sérieusement means “We need to talk about it seriously”. “Faut que” is short for “Il faut que” (it’s necessary that), “qu’on en parle” is “that we talk about it”, and “sérieusement” means “seriously”.
Transliteration: My roommate leaves always dragging his stuff everywhere. I him have already told, but he forgets each time. Need that we about it talk seriously.

Phrase: Y’avait un concert gratuit dans le parc hier soir, c’était super sympa. J’y suis allé avec des potes un peu par hasard. Bonne ambiance, bonne musique.
English: There was a free concert in the park last night, it was really nice. I went with some friends kind of by chance. Good vibes, good music.
Grammar and Structure: - Y’avait un concert gratuit dans le parc hier soir is casual for “Il y avait un concert gratuit”, meaning “There was a free concert in the park last night”.- C’était super sympa means “It was really nice”. “Super sympa” is casual for “very pleasant”.- J’y suis allé avec des potes un peu par hasard means “I went with some friends kind of by chance”. “J’y suis allé” is “I went there”, “par hasard” means “by chance”.- Bonne ambiance, bonne musique is a casual way to say “Good vibes, good music”.
Transliteration: There was a free concert in the park yesterday evening, it was super nice. I there am gone with some buddies a bit by chance. Good atmosphere, good music.

Phrase: Mon téléphone bug depuis la dernière mise à jour. Les applis plantent et la batterie tient plus. J’espère qu’ils vont corriger ça vite.
English: My phone has been glitching since the last update. Apps keep crashing and the battery doesn’t last anymore. I hope they fix it soon.
Grammar and Structure: - Mon téléphone bug depuis la dernière mise à jour means “My phone has been glitching since the last update”. “Bug” is a borrowed word meaning “to glitch or crash”.- Les applis plantent et la batterie tient plus means “The apps crash and the battery doesn’t last anymore”. “Plantent” is slang for “crash”, and “tient plus” means “doesn’t hold up anymore”.- J’espère qu’ils vont corriger ça vite means “I hope they fix it soon”. “Corriger” means “to fix”, and “vite” means “quickly / soon”.
Transliteration: My phone bugs since the last update. The apps crash and the battery holds no more. I hope they will fix that fast.

Phrase: L’autre jour, je suis retombé sur des vieilles photos de lycée. Ça m’a fait tout bizarre. On a tous tellement changé depuis.
English: The other day, I came across some old high school photos. It felt so strange. We’ve all changed so much since then.
Grammar and Structure: - L’autre jour, je suis retombé sur des vieilles photos de lycée means “The other day, I came across some old high school photos”. “Retomber sur” means “to come across again”.- Ça m’a fait tout bizarre means “It felt so strange”. “Tout bizarre” means “really strange or weird”.- On a tous tellement changé depuis means “We’ve all changed so much since then”. “Tellement” adds the sense of “so much”.
Transliteration: The other day, I fell again on some old photos of high school. That made me all weird. We have all so much changed since.
